intro: Senecio saniensis, commonly known as the Sani Mountains groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky, arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Senecio saniensis produces small yellow flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
